Key Arguments: The proposed bill represents a significant government overreach.
There is concern about who will control the determination of what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
The legislation threatens open debate, discussion, and differing opinions.
The bill is seen as an infringement on freedom of speech, which the submitter believes is guaranteed by the Australian Constitution.
The submitter views any government action to change freedom of speech rights as treasonous.
Notable Quotes: This is the thin edge of the wedge; we need to have open debate and discussion and differing opinions.
Itâ€™s quite simple, any act by the government to change our freedom of speech rights which are guaranteed under the Australian Constitution is a Treasonous Act upon the Australian people.
